reviews.text: The food was very good, even though they only had 2 courses from the menu (which was a big menu), but not complaining because it was good. We did wait a bit for it, but it was understandable considering the time we went. I recommend it if you want to try traditional food.

I was in Bratislava a week ago, and since I was nearby, I used Google Maps to find a suitable restaurant. This one seemed interesting, with affordable prices and delicious food.

I was a bit hesitant because of the negative reviews about the staff, but I didn't encounter that. The waiter I approached didn't understand my question in English, so he brought a girl from the kitchen who showed me where I could sit - I needed a table close to the sockets. I didn't have to wait long for beer or food, and the waiter was polite.

When it comes to beer, I cannot say much since I'm not much of a beer fan, but the food lived up to all expectations. I ordered chicken steak on asparagus risotto with parmesan and bacon chips (kurací steak na špargľovom rizote s parmezánom a slaninovom chipsom).
Best restaurant in Bratislava, great food and beer. I recommend the restaurant to everyone who is visiting the city.

Great place open until late, good different choices of dishes. For appetizer we had the baked Camembert cheese, was really good and different.

Skewer was nice could defnitely have more meat more than half of it was vegetables.

They also have their own brewery and the interior is very spacious.

A warm and lively tavern-like place with copper everywhere.
This brasserie atmosphere is reflected in the delicious and tasty dishes, all with good beers.
The staff is a little cold but very efficient.
Ideal for group meals.  To do without hesitation

#LetsGuide #Bratislava #Brasserie #Tested #Recommended
